item.title: Annie add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Take me or leave me; or, as is the usual order of things, both." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Annie add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Beauty is only skin deep, but ugly goes clean to the bone." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Annie add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "What fresh hell is this?" -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Annie add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "By the time you swear you're his, Shivering and sighing. And he vows his passion is, Infinite, undying. Lady make note of this -- One of you is lying." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Annie add a quote by John Kennedy Toole
item.description:
"...I doubt very seriously whether anyone will hire me.'
What do you mean, babe? You a fine boy with a good education.'
Employers sense in me a denial of their values.' He rolled over onto his back. 'They fear me. I suspect that they can see that I am forced to function in a century I loathe. This was true even when I worked for the New Orleans Public Library." -- John Kennedy Toole

item.title: Annie add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "That was the year, my twenty-eighth, when I was discovering that not all of the promises would be kept, that some things are in fact irrevocable and that it had counted after all, every evasion and every procrastination, every mistake, every word, all of it." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Annie add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "The world, even the smallest parts of it, is filled with things you don't know." -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Annie add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description:
"Do you hate people?
I don't hate them...I just feel better when they're not around." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Annie add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "For those who believe in God, most of the big questions are answered. But for those of us who can't readily accept the God formula, the big answers don't remain stone-written. We adjust to new conditions and discoveries. We are pliable. Love need not be a command nor faith a dictum. I am my own god. We are here to unlearn the teachings of the church, state, and our educational system. We are here to drink beer. We are here to kill war. We are here to laugh at the odds and live our lives so well that Death will tremble to take us." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Annie add a quote by Tao Lin
item.description: "You were one person alive and your brain was encased in a skull. There were other people out there. It took effort to be connected." -- Tao Lin
